name: Holiday Inn San Francisco Fishermans Wharf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were booked into the Beach Annex which was nearer to the wharf. There was a Dennys on site which was open 24 hours which was good for getting coffee etc while getting adjusted to the time difference with the UK. Rooms were comfortable and clean and the area was quiet. Staff in the main hotel were helpful. There is also free access to the Internet in the main hotel in the 5th floor. Our expectations weren't high having read earlier reviews so we were pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Great location, clean rooms, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in may 2010. We hotel staff were more than helpfull, they let us choose what floor we wanted to stay on and what type of bed!!
reviews.title: Best Holiday Inn ever!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: There us is a resturant at the hotel called Dennys...... the food is great... good value and excellent service...
reviews.title: Not so Holiday Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location you can walk to practically everything. However just round the corner from the hotel next to the italian resturant there is a hop on hop off bus!! You can do this for the day or get a 2 day pass.. we got a 2 days pass so we could do all 3 loops. It cost $50 each. It was great an open top bus, took you to all the main site, union square, golden gate bridge, china town etc....
reviews.title: Clean,quiet rooms, excellent location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are so many souvenier shops and places to eat you are spoilt for choice.....
reviews.title: Great location, need to work on deep cleaning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a disastourous check in I.E.given the wrong room so woke a person up tring to open the room door.But apart from that everything was fine,great location.within walking distance from the wharfe.I can thoroughly recomend the Alcatraz tour well worth the money, very well organised.plus the cable car ride.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room turned out to be in the 'Beach' Annex and despite some previous comments, it is about 200 yards and 5 minutes or so away from the main building. I didn't however, appreciate having to trek back there to check out at the end of our stay - how about manning the desk in the annex building folks?
reviews.title: It's all about location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The overall feel of the decor and furnishings is somewhat dated, the hallway lighting fixtures are pretty tired for one thing. Our room though was more than adequate, bedding and bathroom linens etc were well up to modern HI standards, even if the fixtures weren't. Some periodic external noise (hey this is a big city) but we enjoyed our stay and found the location to be perfect - a few minutes walk from the Cable Car and the streetcars.
reviews.title: Some frustrations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Essentially we slept and recovered from long days out enjoying the stunning and captivating city. Our encounters with the staff were uniformly positive and even though there were some aspects that weren't up to a higher standard, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel at the right price.
reviews.title: Average hotel with good location for Fishermans Wharf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: One excellent touch that was appreciated was the EZ board computer that allowed us to log in and print our airline boarding cards on the morning of our departure.
reviews.title: Travel from hotel to Amtrak Emeryville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel made an ideal base from which to explore San Fransisco. Just a short walk from Fishermans Walk - Pier 39, with its restaurants and shops, and close to the 'trolleys' that will take you all over San Fransisco.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn - great location, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel room was clean and comfortable, good bathroom, plenty of hot water and nice fluffy towels. We were on the 'business floor' and had free internet access in the business centre.
reviews.title: Handy for Alcatraz

likes.liked: — location for alcatraz and Fisherman's wharf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Breakfast was good, bar staff very friendly, but we had a Thanksgiving buffet meal which I thought was not great value (all rather bland) The little coffee & snack shop in the foyer is excellent value
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, a value for money hotel.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dont miss Alcatraz night tour - full of atmosphere. Take a boat trip over the bay for some great nightime pictures of the city, and of course you have to see the Golden gate bridge. Enjoy.
reviews.title: Nice hotel-good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Earlier this year my myself, along with my husband and two daughters aged 12 & 14 embarked on the trip of a lifetime to the United States. Unfortunately on arrival in San Francisco our youngest daughter had a severe tummy bug and we were very anxious to get to our hotel so she could rest. Upon arrival at the Holiday Inn Fishermans Wharf we checked in and were given the key to our room which was extremely tired and dated. The curtains were closed when we entered the room and when we drew them back we were horrified to find that we were looking out into a carpark at a brick wall! It was also very noisy and the room was very cold thus my daughter was unable to rest well. The staff were very unsympathetic of our plight and after spending approximately 3 hours on the premises we promptly left to another hotel in Union Square (The Handlery) which bent over backwards for us. On checking out of the Holiday Inn we were assured by the young woman on the desk that we would not be charged for the accommodation which we had booked ahead for 3 nights but were horrified to discover on arrival back in New Zealand we had been charged on our credit card for 3 nights accommodation. After several costly phonecalls and some time later we finally received a credit for this.
reviews.title: Never Ever Again!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We will never stay in this hotel again, nor any other Holiday Inn again as we found others that we used in the United States to also be disappointing. This is not a hotel chain we would recommend.
reviews.title: Good location for seeing the sights

likes.disliked: — being in the other building separate to the main hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Holiday Inn, Fisherman's Wharf for four nights in October 2007 with three friends on a three centre holiday with Virgin Holidays - San Fransisco first, then on to Las Vegas and Los Angeles. We specifically chose the area of Fisherman's Wharf as it is geared towards the tourist and as we had never visited San Fransisco before, it suited our needs.
reviews.title: Save on Parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's approximately a 20 minute drive from the airport and check in was quick. Virgin Holidays use the second building in the next street but it was only a couple of minutes walk away. The Denny's on the ground floor of our building was really handy and there's a shop and coffee bar in the main hotel foyer. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and also quiet as ours were on the 5th floor.
reviews.title: Nice Stay at the Holday Inn Fishermans Wharf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: It's only a short walk to the main sights of Fisherman's Wharf and to the cable car turnaround. As it's a busy area, it felt safe at night. We didn't visit the hotel restaurant, preferring to get out and about. Boudin's upstairs restaurant overlooking the sea is worth a visit and there's plenty of choice for food and drink at Pier 39.
reviews.title: Not one I'd pick again

likes.disliked: — Stuck in a building away from rest of conference attendees - farther walk than other hotels!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the annex across the street. Read reviews of people having noise problems. No problem during our stay.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy walk to the Wharf and on the upper edge of North Beach area. Trolley, streetcar & bus stops within 1-2 blocks. Felt safe walking during the day & evening.
reviews.title: We loved this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a couple of hours early for check-in but were able to get into our room. After a 6 hr flight, we really appreciated it.
reviews.title: Quite happy with this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf was everything we expected and more. The location is wonderful, within easy walking distance to the Wharf, Ghirardelli Square, Pier 39 and the cable car turn-around.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are spacious and clean, although the walls are a bit thin and the outside traffic could be loud at times, the other aspects of this hotel made up for it.
reviews.title: Excellent location...parking VERY expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights here in a room in the Beach St site. A few blocks down to Ghiradelli Square, a block down to the main street fronting the wharf and Pier 39 an easy stroll of around 15-20 mins.
reviews.title: OK, but didn't like the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had requested a room with 2 doubles, and on checking in requested a rollaway be put in the room. By the time we had crossed the street from reception, the boy from housekeeping was waiting at the door with the rollaway. Unfortunately, when we entered the room, water was coming through the ceiling, so we had to cross back over to reception to request a room change. This was done efficiently and promptly. It was a bit of a squeeze with the rollaway, but with only being there 3 nights, it wasn't a problem.
reviews.title: Not too bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: . Two of our party wanted to go to see the 49's football game, and the concierge, Ryan, could not do enough to help sort out tickets, and advice with transport.
reviews.title: Honeymoon

likes.liked: — View over Fishermans Wharf and Alcatraz Island
likes.disliked: — Tacky Denny Restaurant on Ground Floor

reviews.title: Fab Location
reviews.text: Overall, handy location for the Wharf, cable cars & trolleys. Hertz, Avis rentals, one minute walk . Clean rooms, comfortable beds, staff we came into contact with, all polite & professional. All in all, hotel was o.k, but would not stay here again as we disliked the Wharf area.

reviews.title: Loved the Holiday Inn at The Wharf
reviews.text: If you are thinking of riding a bike over the Bridge, be careful if you are not a keen cyclist. The info leaflet said there was one small incline. From Fort Mason you have to climb a double incline, very steep ( everyone we saw were pushing their bikes up) without a cycle path - you share the road with the traffic. I am not saying this to put anyone off, just to let people be aware before they book. We made it ,and bought the t-shirt!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the holiday Inn for 4 nights and would definately recommend this hotel to anyone else. It is not one for luxury and pomp, but the rooms were spacious, clean and very pleasant. The location is excellent, within easy walking distance to the wharf and all it can offer, restaurants, outings and even within easy reach to other sights such as Lombard Street and Union Square! For the price, location and cleanliness, this hotel is definately good value for money!
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Holiday Inn for 3 nights over the Fleet Weekend in Oct! Loved the convenient location...bicycle rental was just around the corner, and the major car rental companies are right behind the hotel (for those who plan to pick up or return their cars). Also, it was within easy walking distance (around 20-30 minutes for our speed, with lots of pictures taking along the way!) to Pier 39 and the departure point for Alcatraz.
reviews.title: An enjoyable weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Though we arrived from the 5 star hotels at Las Vegas, we were not disppointed at all. In fact, we were extremely pleased with the hotel. The hotel also has a pillow menu, which you could choose the pillow which suits you best. We requested for a room in the Main building, which was nice. However, it was not a King Bed room. We were told that they could only offer a King Bed in the annexed building. Oh well. The only slight downside is we had a room at the corner of the hotel block, on the ground floor. The main road junction was just outside our window and it could get a little noisy in the morning.
reviews.title: Everything great!

likes.disliked: — If you were in the Beach Building, far away from pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone.
reviews.title: City by the bay
Great location
reviews.text: We stayed here from 6th-9th September and were really pleased with hotel. Concierge very helpful and had booked us on night city tour before we even had chance to check in! So we checked in at 3pm and were picked up at 5pm for tour.That was great value.. starting off with dinner in McCormicks and Culeto's seafood restaurant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf for 4 nights in June 2007. Upon arriving we were shown to our room in the Annexe building. No bar, no restaurant (just a Dennys) no receptionist. The room was fine but it over looked the dumpsters at the back and faced a brick wall. Not ideal but we thought it would just have to do. At 6 am the next morning we got an unscheduled alarm call as the truck arrived to empty the dumpsters. The noise was so horrendous it felt like the truck was actually reversing through our bedroom. An hour later when we had just managed to get back to sleep the truck arrived back to empty more dumpsters!
reviews.title: Staff need to go on customer service training!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went down to request that we be moved to another room and the receptionist was very frosty. Muttered a lot about if "we didnt like that room then we would like this one" etc. I finally lost my temper and yelled at her "we have had this trip booked for 6 months and flown half way across the world. There is no way you are putting us in a crappy room in an annexe that you only give to someone when there is nothing left". All of a sudden there is a room available in the main building over looking the pool, Ideal! It was a nice room, no noise at all.
reviews.title: Great Location - But Noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge was completely off-hand when we asked him to book transfers to the airport and actually snatched our flight details out of my husband's hand. The reception staff were very unhelpful when we told them we had a problem with our bill. To top it all our airport transfer that the concierge arranged was late. We decided to save time and use the auto check in terminal they have in reception. We went through the check in procedure and the boarding cards did not print out. We explained this at reception and their answer was "oh, that's not working". (They knew it wasn't working but did not think to put a sign on it saying so) We then had a job trying to explain at the airport why we had checked in but had no boarding cards.
reviews.title: Ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The whole place was extremely unprofessional and the staff had a "couldn't care less" attitude.
reviews.title: Disappointing Hotel
Very nic elocation and staff were great
reviews.text: On the plus side, the room was OK and clean and location good for Fisherman's Wharf and the Cable Car to Union Square.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a difference a decent bed makes! Centrally located within Fisherman's Wharf, this was the perfect base for our short stay in SF. Being a Holiday Inn, what you see is what you get, and it is all perfectly clean and comfortable, and cannot really be faulted.
reviews.title: WYSIWYG

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The on-site Denny's would not be my first recommendation for dining; shop around the local fare along the bay front.
reviews.title: Maybe not ideal for couples, but good location..we liked it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Seemed a 'family' orientated hotel in the very touristy fishermans wharf.....bit unsure if we would like it ...but..WE DID. We were disapointed that we didnt get the single king size room that that we requested and got two large doubles instead...as we figured that we were more likely to get a family in the adjoining room...and sure enough we did....whats more they were very noisy and we could hear them through the adjoining door. I complained that night and the next morining we were moved to another room. That was within earshot of Denny's below the hotel and we did pick up a fair bit of street noise...but it wasnt too bad. Large rooms. Better facilities than a much pricier hotel that i also syaed in whilst in sf. Tea/coffee making in room. Safe deposit box etc. Liked the wharf...it is gloriously tacky but very 'safe' compared to other parts of the city and very good for getting to other parts of sf...alcatraz, the ferries etc. The food at the wharf isnt great but not far away are places like fog city diner and the italian restaurants in north beach. I would recommend this hotel...but be warned about the noise.....I just dont understand why hotels dont put all the familes together so they can make as much noise as they want and have a massive kiddy fest and keep them away from couples who want a bit of peace and quiet when on holiday.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Spacious room very clean. Check in was fast and friendly service. Buffet breakfast was good, plenty of choice. I would recommend this hotel just for the location. Its close to the piers. Shuttle services are available which we used and was surprised how good this was. It cost us 16 dolllars each to the airport. I liked the fact the hotel has someone in the lobby who can help you with trips and entertainment. There is a pool but its outdoors and San Francisco was cold even in August. Will definately be going back to this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Location near Fisherman's Wharf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading and researching many hotels in SF area, I selected this Holiday Inn (mainly because it was the best price I could find and wanted to be near Fisherman's Wharf area). Although the hotel looks a little dated on the outside, the inside looked like it recently had been remodeled. The rooms were very comfortable (very comfy mattress and loved having the choice of soft and firm pillows). We stayed in the annex building across the street (this building is for the non-smokers). The Denny's restaurant is inside this hotel (it was very convenient to have breakfast there in the mornings before we headed off doing our tours and excursions for the day).
reviews.title: Good location. Clean and pleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Originally I wanted to stay in the Union Square area, but there was the bay to breakers race the weekend we were going to be there and the prices were too high. I won a great price on priceline for this hotel. We actaully liked this area. We only hung out at the wharf one day, but the transportation was really east to get everywhere we wanted. We actaully preferred not to stay in Union Sq. We weren't going to SF to shop, we could do that back in NY. We got the other building with Denny's in the lobby. It was very quiet. Not sure what people were saying when they say it's loud here. We didn't experience that and had a good night's sleep. We stayed in a handicapped room with a shower "room". Not my preference, but we didn't ask to be switched. We were out all day sightseeing and only came back to sleep and rest. We nad no issues and would reccomend this hotel to the great price we paid.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked in at about 6.30pm on Saturday 29th May and were given what I sincerely hope is the worst room in the hotel. It was in the Beach annex, below grund level, and facing directly onto the street where we were treated to the sight of peoples' legs as they passed and every detail of their conversation as they passed the air con input.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings about this one...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierege could not have cared less and rather rudely told me to try again for a room change the following morning between 11am and 1pm. This is ridiculous - they must know which rooms will become available and could have just allocated one to us, but perhaps the fact we were Hotwire customers meant that we were to get poor service.
reviews.title: Great Location for sightseeing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to see how the night went, because we were reluctant to spend any of our San Francisco time queuing for potentially non-existent rooms or moving belongings, and in the event we were fine. The road noise stopped quite early and once the curtains were closed the room was quite lovely. I had paid UK Travelodge prices for something altogether much better, so we decided to put up with the dreadful location of the room because the location of the hotel and the inside of the room were so good.
reviews.title: HOLIDAY INN FISHERMAN'S WHARF, OK FOR 2-3 DAYS ONLY.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010
reviews.text: We avoided the "scary" street (I think it was Jones Street) by heading along Beach until Taylor or Mason which were much quieter. However the street was not so much scary as completely packed with people impeding progress. And there's a Walgreen's which is good - how many blister Bandaids did we buy this holiday?!
reviews.title: Excellent location. No need for car. Rooms could use an update

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chose this hotel after a previous enjoyable stay.On arrival the hotel had no record of the booking but after a short delay, owing to the receipt I provided from my travel company, they found me a room.I was concerned as the receptionist commented that the bed was smaller than other rooms and due to the 8 hour time change my travel company could not be contacted to confirm they would pay for the room.
reviews.title: Beware of room 1147 if you want to sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was okay but the position was not.It was situated on the corner of a busy junction controlled by traffic lights.All night long traffic was thundering past,brakes screaming and beeping.We tried leaving the air con on to drown the noise out but you couldn't set it lower than temp 65 when it cut off and as the room became warmer it ROARED into life again,something else to disturb us.
reviews.title: Poor Holiday Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was also below road and pavement level so the curtains had to be kept closed all the time to prevent pedestrians from looking in especially as it was a crossing.
reviews.title: Solid Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The manageress did offer to move us when they got confirmation of payment from my travel company who insist that they had confirmation of the booking from the begining from the hotel,but to pack up and hang around the next day for a new cleaned room was not an option.
reviews.title: served a purpose but no frills

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The manageress stated that the room was within the range that I had paid for but I am convinced this room is not used on a regular basis and I would have been given a different room if the Holiday Inn had not messed up the booking.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a good value and great location. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, and the location was excellent. The only issue I had was that my husband and I were traveling on our anniversary and the hotel was not able to get us a King bed. So we had a room with two doubles - not very romantic. One night I awoke to my husband sleeping in the other bed...it's our anniversary and we're sleeping in separate beds! But other than that, I think it's a good value and would recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: Good value, Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I can thoroughly recommend this hotel. The rooms are spacious, extremely clean and the most comfortable beds. Great location as well, right text to the trolley stop but just back from the Wharf to be quiet at night. Helpful friendly staff. We stayed in the Beach Building across the road from the main hotel with a Denny's in the lobby which was great for that morning cup of tea to take away.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location and the most comfortable beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed three night (free courtesy of Priority Club points). Wouldn't usually stay here because room rates were expensive but since it was free, we though 'value for money' was excellent. The location was perfect being very close to Fisherman's Wharf. Room was spacious for a large city. Had to pay extra for a car park space..
reviews.title: Good location, okay hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007
reviews.text: A reasonable hotel. Clean with comfortable beds. Restaurant OK but betters ones if you take a walk towards Pier 39.
reviews.title: Reasonable Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you want Pier 39 and the events around it and not able to walk to far this is not the hotel for you unless you want to keep shelling out for cab fares. We had my mother with us and as she could not walk far we had to get a cab if we wanted to go to Pier 39.
reviews.title: Excellent Location. Very Average Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location, a couple of blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and the trolley buses. We got upgraded to the fifth (business) floor when we asked for a king bed with no fuss.
reviews.title: Straight to the fifth floor

likes.liked: — Free internet access on the business floor!
likes.disliked: — Split sites for some rooms (not affecting us)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean and tidy. No real problems. They exceeded our expectations.
reviews.title: great stay !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had a wonderful stay at the holiday inn. we were on honeymoon and they upgraded us to the 5th floor in the main building which is the business suite. The room was lovely, large and facing alcatraz so we had a lovely view. The hotel concierge were really helpful and the hotel is in a great location near the trolleys and little italy and fishermans wharf.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dennys which is part of the other building is a 24hour restaurant and we had breakfast there twice. It was lovely food and cheap.
reviews.title: Good location

likes.disliked: — Price of food in the restaurant

reviews.title: Clean and recently remodeled hotel
reviews.text: overall we had a great stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: We are a little slow writing this review. We stayed here for four nights and loved the close proximity of this hotel to Fishermans Wharf itself, which is good for any sightseeing around the bay, etc. Our biggest praise though is for the staff and service in the restaurant. They have the best steaks. So so tender and that is saying something when you are from Australia where we have the best steaks. It was my birthday whilst staying here and the manager and staff of the restaurant made it really enjoyable for me, arranging for some cakes and even singing happy birthday. My daughter also enjoyed having internet access and I enjoyed finally having laundry facilities which were sadly lacking in our other accommodation choices on the west coast. All in all we would recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved the Restaurant

likes.liked: — its close proximity to fishermans wharf area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: As all the other reviews state, location, location, location....nothing here "wowed" us over our 3 night stay except the easy walk to Fishermans Wharf. I thought for $245/night (AAA rate) the room was a little small for our family of 4....bathroom was decent, shower pretty good and all were very clean. No fridge is a HUGE incovenience with kids...had to ask for extra ice buckets to keep a few drinks handy and cold. Ate one meal at the restaurant in the main building where we stayed...DO NOT recommend it! Kids eat free (meals for them were pretty good), but not a lot of selection for us grownups and the prices are outrageous! (Doesn't even make up for the fact that the kids meals are free!) Can't comment much on the service...didn't really need anything during our stay. Parking is pretty steep, but seems on par with everything else in the area. We never got a chance to use the pool (weather was very cold, rainy and windy), but it looked ok. Overall, doubt we'll be back to San Francisco anytime soon, but would probably chance another hotel next time anyway.
reviews.title: Ehhhh...so-so stay at the Holiday Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We were in a room in the annex, down the street and around the corner. There was no desk clerk in that building. When I called the front desk of the main bldg. on Friday at 5pm to get a taxi (I'm an entertainer and was performing downtown), no one answered the phone! This went on 20 minutes, till I ran down the street to the main bldg. in my gown to have the porter hail a cab! Rooms clean, but no refrigerator (much less a microwave) for those expensive leftovers from Fishermans Wharf. No towels at the pool at 10am Saturday. Exercise room about 12ft x 12 ft., not much in there. Paid $2.50 in the gift shop for 4 ($.026) postcard stamps, clerk told me it costs $.69 to send postcard! I checked at front desk and was told the same. Had to ask the concierge to get the right postage amount! Other than location, I do not recommend this hotel, and it should be rated 2 stars, not 3. Next time we'll pay the difference and try the Sheraton.
reviews.title: NOT a 3 Star Hotel!

likes.disliked: — Except for concierge and porter, help was uninformed to surly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is a great location. It is an easy walk to Fisherman's Wharf, the cable cars, Ghiardelli Chocolate, and even the Alcatraz Tour, though that was a bit further. Parking was $35 per night, but what can you do. The main lobby was very nice, but we got stuck in the building next door, which I believe is where all the riff-raff with AAA discounts are condemned. There is no parking there, except for around 10 spots near the main entrance which were constantly full. So, you have to double park, drop off the luggage, then drive back to the posh hotel to park. Then you repeat the process when you leave. The "annex" is barren, except for the Denny's, which was crowded (not sure why with so much great food around). The rooms were adequate and clean. We only got 3 bath towels for the 4 of us, and it took over an hour on two consecutive nights to get a 4th. Our view was of the tourists in the next wing of the annex. We would stay again only for the location, but try to get a room in the main building. Maybe things are nicer there.
reviews.title: Great Location, but That's It.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights at the end of a 17 day vacation in California. The hotel staff are very professional and helpful. As we used our Priority Club membership number when we booked (even though we have only used it once before) we were given an excellent room exclusive to club members and given tokens for two free drinks in the bar. Nice touch we thought. Also on our floor there were three PC's available so we could use the internet free of charge.
reviews.title: Great location, very helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved everything about SF, including the hotel - maybe it was a little pricey, but you are paying for the location and the "brand" - we thought the location was fantastic, and the hotel really clean - no problems -it was a little noisy in the hotel room at night, but most cities are noisy, so we had earplugs and had no problems. We never ate in the hotel, as there were a million places to go, almost on the doorstep. We particularyl liked Fiddlers Green and Tiernans pubs - both had live music on every night and had a really nice atmosphere. - yes there are beggars, but its a big city, and all cities have them - we never felt threatened and felt really safe walking round any time day or night. As for those who say Fishermans Wharf is a tourist trap, well, maybe, but I am a tourist & loved it !! Had a beautiful meal at McCormick & Kuleto in Ghiradhelli Square, and another great one at Cioppinos on Jefferson - walked over the bridge, did Alcatraz, Muir Woods, went up the glass elevator in the westin st francis (great views of Union Sq) ; LOVED everything - we are already making plans to return. - I really did leave my heart in San Francisco !!
reviews.title: LOVED EVERYTHING

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Typical American hotel: clean but well worn.
reviews.title: Bring your ear-plugs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006
reviews.text: Area very tacky, Blackpool in a warm climate with a liberal dosing of beggars !
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not the sort of area where you would wander the streets after dark.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we stayed in was very noisey. You could hear people talking on the street outside. You could hear every car that passed.
reviews.title: Close to Fishermans Wharf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005
reviews.text: we stayed at the holiday inn without actually staying there if you know what I mean- our room was in the annnexe around the corner. It was fine and probably a bit less noisy than the main part, but the downside was that we didn't get to use any of the hotel facilities, including the pool, and only discovered the delightful pergamino's cafe over the road for breakfast on day 4.
reviews.title: to stay or not to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005
reviews.text: The room was spacious and clean, with a safe and hanging rail for clothes rather than a wardrobe, spacious bathroom (well big enough for us). The annexe had a Denny's restaurant where we ate breakfast the first few days, our son loved it but the food was only average and it was a bit pricey. Still everything about our California holiday was expensive this time round.
reviews.title: Loved my stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005
reviews.text: We had hired a car because we wnated to visit several places independently, rather than take a young boy on too many coach excursions, but after getting lost from the airport (due to some crappy directions given us by our holiday firm) we ended up driving through all the worst and busiest bits of SF, including right down the cnetre of Chinatown! Ultimately, we decided that the car had been a mistake, especially as there is such a good transport network in the city. Fisherman's Wharf was fun, and not as ghastly as a lot of people made out, plus, we had so many other sights to see, including the fab Golden gate Bridge and a trip on the outside of the famous cable car at Powell and Hyde (for which there was a considerable wait, so get there early). Fisherman's Wharf has some nice seafood restaurants, again pricey, and is all on the level, so walkign around is easy. I would certainyl recommend it for families, as there is Pier 39 with the sealions and the ferries for Alcatraz(a must) plus amusement arcade and lots of shops. Also go see Coit Tower - walk up Telegraph Hill if you have the energy(exhausting!) or drive up an then get the lift to the top for some great views. Chinatown a must also, we ate at the wonderful Emperess of China, which has views of Coit Tower and food authentic, decor beautiful and waiters very attentive (good value as well). Visit The Fort underneath the bridge, it's a big former miltary garrison that has been renovated and opened to the public, very inetersting for children and adults alike. Take a city tour early in your trip, it will give you a good account of what the city has to offer and then you can pick and choose where to return. Ate at the Cliff House on the promontary about 5-6 miles from SF, lovley food and superb Pacific coast/beach views. Wrap up warm - SF is very chilly in the morninngs and the fog invariably covers the bridge, although it usually clears by the afternoon - average temp when we were there was 65C (40 degress less than at our friend's house two hours inland!). Woudl return to SF tomorrow if we could, and to the Holiday Inn as well. San Franciscans are an amiable lot, non-conformist and very relaxed about life in general, and SF is the one city in America where you will find interesting house architecture
reviews.title: better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2005
reviews.text: My family stayed 6 days here and loved it. The room was clean, bathroom was kept spotless and the staff were very friendly. We were at the Beach Street building and it was very quiet and comfortable. The beds could've been a little softer, but we managed. The location was great just a couple of blocks to the Wharf and several excellent places to eat, and even a Walgreens. I will stay here again when I go visit the area again.
reviews.title: Nothing to complain about

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel in August 2005 virtually begging them for a quiet room having read the reviews! We were told we could change rooms if it was too noisy but although there was quite a bit of traffic noise, it was not unbearable...ear plugs help! We were in the annexe building up the road on the fifth floor with an adjoining room for the kids. The rooms were spacious and clean and nice bathrooms. We found Dennys restaurant extremely overpriced and only went once. I would like to reiterate a previous reviewer 's comment about camcorder/camera salesmen in this area. We were nearly persuaded to buy a digital camcorder which we didn't really need. They aren't as cheap as the salesman tried to make out.
reviews.title: Try Pergamino for breakfast
Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the Holiday Inn at Fisherman's Wharf. Our room was very large, clean and updated with nice bedding, window treatment, and fluffy towels. The only downside was that we were not in the main building, but across the street. It is confusing, there are two Holiday Inn's -one is a Holiday Inn "Express" that comes with breakfast and then there is the Holiday Inn (no breakfast). The location is GREAT. Walk to everything in the Wharf and Pier 39. Parking was $35 a night - ugh!, so we found free street parking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have stayed here several times over the last few years. I just got back from a two night stay yesterday. It is really in a great location as har as the Wharf goes and there is lots to do in the area. I have always stayed in the main building so I can't comment on the secondary building. I have always been upgraded to the executive floor (5) but there really isn't much to make it "executive. This last stay my coworker had a room on the 4th floor and mine was a little bigger/nicer but his room was fine.
reviews.title: Great Location, Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I will say it seems they have upgraded some things like bedspreads and such, but it is not a new hotel. That being said, it is clean, comfy and in a great location. Many of the guest seem to be from the UK. I would also say it is a "kids welcome" type of hotel.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel right in the centre of San Francisco. We stayed 3 days and the service was excellent. Highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: spot on location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights as a recommendation from our travel agent and wasn't disappointed.
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.disliked: — The age of the hotel and need for remodeling.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: We (2 adults, 2 children ages 10y, 15y) stayed for 4 nights on the 5th floor. We had to use our key card in a special slot on the elevator in order to get to this floor. There were 2 computers and printers on the floor (also on other floors) with free internet access. ROOM: 2 double beds; mattresses a little too soft (perhaps old?) and our backs were sore in the AM. There was a TV, microwsave and refrigerator. Roomy, clean and comfortable. The view: looking at the beautiful houses on the hill and overlooking the pool. Highly recommend getting a room on this side of the hotel (North Pointe St.) instead of asking for Bay view-you can't really see too much bay and mostly buildings. Bathroom: clean, ok size. We were able to park our car in the underground garage and gain access to it at any time. The best part: when we checked out, we could still keep our car in the garage until 6pm. We are an active family who walks everywhere in SF 95% of the time and enjoyed being so close to the wharf, Nob Hill, China Town, North Beach (great Itlalian cafes), the churches, Coit Tower, and the Embarcadero. Watched firewords at the beach and it was nice to be able to walk a short distance back to our room. Everyone was very pleasant and had a quick ck-in and ck-out. There's an ok restaurant downstairs, but service is questionable-saw our waitress once when ordering and then sat around waiting for the ck after we finished. Recommend Pergarino's across the street. Cable cars are close by. The only drawback was in the early AM hrs, we could clearly hear the delivery trucks, garbage trucks, etc. Good part: did not hear any neighbors at any time. Pool: on the cool side. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. Good for the price and yes, we would return.
reviews.title: great location
Will Stay Again
reviews.text: My brother made reservations for my mother, him and me for 3 nights. The reservations agent was right when he said it was not a 'view hotel,' but we weren't there to stay in our room. With a couple of exceptions, the staff was helpful and courteous. We didn't get the right information from any of the 3 concierges we asked at different times of our stay. We went into the bar one afternoon before heading out to dinner. There was no wait staff and the bartender made no effort to provide service. With those exceptions, our stay was very nice. The room and beds were comfortable, and the location of the hotel is probably it's best point. It's not a luxury hotel, but then, we weren't expecting one... it's a Holiday Inn!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: Note: Previous reviewer is confused about which property he stayed in. Don't confuse this with the Holiday Inn Express across the street (as he did). I've stayed at both hotels and this was was better.
reviews.title: Great choice in the Fisherman's Wharf area!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: This is not inexpensive as one might expect from H.I. Two days stay with breakfast and parking came to $499.00. So you really have to take those 2 things into account. (Of course we chose to eat conveniently at our hotel - we could have gone 2 blks to Starbucks and paid a bit less). The front desk staff here is excellent - as good as any 4 star hotel that I've stayed in (particularly Robert - what a pro!). They were so accomadating and professional with every request.
reviews.title: Comfortable Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: The room was spacious, modern and clean with an amazing view of Alcatraz! We were offered a roll away for our little one at no additional charge. The location is awesome - close to every single thing and just a cable car ride away from anything else. The pool is quite nice. Parking is expensive, but so easy.
reviews.title: Awful - don't stay here!
Every thing you would expect from a Travel Inn!!
reviews.text: Lets not beat around the bush here....Its a Travel Inn. Personally we expected a little more from Virgin Holidays then this, but it was in a great location, it was clean, the staff were friendly etc

reviews.title: Clean, cosy & convenient
reviews.text: After all we came to see San Francisco, not a Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005
reviews.text: We are Australians and had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for 3 nights recently and after travelling around the world in 6 weeks I have to say this hotel was one of our more pleasant stays.... We stayed in the annex where Dennys Restaurant is and we found the room spacious, clean & fresh and the bathroom was roomy and also clean.... Whilst it was close to everything including the famous "Fishermans Wharf" and Pier 39 (where there is heaps of shops & restaurants to choose from) we found it very quiet and was able to get a good nights sleep in our hotel room... Yes, the restaurants were a little pricey BUT if you wanted a cheap meal there was always the Clam Chowder in a sour dhoe bun on the wharf to satisfy your hunger... We also found a great restaurant called the "Rainforrest Cafe" on Beach Street... great food at reasonable prices and fantastic staff and atmosphere. Wished I had young kids again to take back there - an amazing place for both young and old... I would highly recommend this hotel and San Fransisco and look forward to my next visit there... Loved it all....
reviews.title: Not bad, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005
reviews.text: A quick warning before I start the review.....if your room is in the annex building, use a bellman ! Getting to the other building includes walking out on to the street in front of the hotel and a good 300 yard walk down a busy road. I lost count of the number of people I saw lugging heavy cases, clearly underestimating how far apart the entrances to the 2 separate buildings are.
reviews.title: Great Location - Walk almost anywhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2004
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights in the annex building in August 2005. The room was satisfactory (2 queen size beds) although the decoration was a bit dated. It was kept clean though and we were impressed by the friendly maid service who went out of her way on a few occasions. There is a 24 hour Dennys in the lobby of the annex, where service was dreadfully slow in the mornings when it gets busy. We had a 30 minute wait for food which was not good when you only have a day and a half in the City and want to get out and see some sights. The famous Lombard Street crooked street is walkable too, although the hill you walk up to get there is VERY steep.
reviews.title: Dirty and Noisy
Tip Top Accomodation
reviews.text: Stayed here mid June and couldn't have been happier- room great - service great - location great

reviews.title: Good location/DIRTY Room
reviews.text: The only niggle was the breakfast - best for breakfast rate wasn't explained properly and our waiter really hassled us for a tip after we had only been sat down for about 10 minutes . Kids also don't really eat for free apparently - they are only allowed 1 item for breakfast - anything else will be charged for!!!! This was resolved but is worth mentioning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: NOT TO BE CONFUSED WITH HOLIDAY INN EXPRESS ACROSS THE STREET
reviews.title: Loved The Holiday Inn at Fishermans Wharf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: So it's in a good local, the price was right but they don't know how to clean a room. Carpeted floor had trash still on it and bathroom floor (well let's just say we knew they didn't clean it)! It didn't get any better on the second day either.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: Convenient location - 1 block from Fisherman's Wharf, about 3 blocks from Cable Cars and 4 blocks from Ghiradelli.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel, in room 303 (Columbus building), from Dec 23, 2007-Dec 27, 2007. We were given a room with 2 double beds (I thought we'd get queens but you never know with priceline) in the main building of the hotel. The hotel is clean and the staff are helpful. The restaurant inside the hotel, The Bristol, is open for breakfast and dinner, and kids eat free with paying adults. The breakfast prices are high (it can be charged to your room), but cheaper than the Denny's across the street, and a buffet is available; all food was made to order. There is a gift shop inside the hotel where you can purchase souveniers or items you may have forgotten, and even stamps for postcards. Our room was small but clean. The bathroom has a coffee maker (makes a single cup at a time), shampoo, conditioner, soap and lotion. The hotel is located one block from a Starbucks and restaurants, and two blocks from the Cable Car turnaround. Pier 39 is within walking distance. Parking is available, but you have to pay $35 a night plus tax (although we were only charged for one night of parking). There is a concierge on site to provide directions or recommendations for things to do. There is an outdoor pool, and a small exercise room. I also noticed a pool table in the restaurant. While I didn't hate the place, I'd probably stay at a Holiday Inn Express next time because they provide a free breakfast and are newer.
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Overall a nice hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007
reviews.text: Great location close to Fishermans Wharf and 10-15 min. to Union Square by taxi or cable car.
reviews.title: Don't take this Dump

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Front desk staff not too helpfull.
reviews.title: Loved the Holiday Inn!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: How ever, the concierge recomended several restaurants - tried one (steak rest.) and it was great and affordable.
reviews.title: Good area
5 nights of hell !
reviews.text: On arrival at the Hotel we were given a ground floor room, which backs on to a wall and the delivery area. The deliveries arrived at 4.30am each morning along with the noise of banging doors and shouting, this lasted for over an hour. The noise of the outside fan was not great either. On asking to change rooms, this took them 3 days to come back to us, for which was then a waste of time moving.

reviews.title: Great location... but noisy!
reviews.text: The room we had was dark given the location within the hotel and we had to leave lights on at all times of the day. The only good thing about this hotel is the location and the door out.

reviews.title: I'm satisfied
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for three nights en-route from Hawaii to the UK.

reviews.title: Excellent Location
reviews.text: We were located on the 3rd floor in the annex building. The room was spacious and comfortable, and our bathroom was huge! We got a free newspaper delivered every morning.

reviews.title: fully satisfied
reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel is it's location - it's opposite Fisherman's Wharf and all the attractions around the bay, e.g. Ghiardelli Square, Pier 39, tourist ferries around the bay / Alcatraz, etc. We walked to Lombard Street (up an impossibly steep hill) and back in approx. half an hour. The terminus of the 'F line' tram to the Ferry Building / Market Street (where all the main shops are) / Castro district was literally across the road - it's only $1.50 each, which includes a free transfer within 90 minutes. The terminus of the Powell / Hyde cable car was also only a few minutes walk (I'd recommend getting there early to avoid the queues. We got there at 9.30am and got straight on. It's expensive though - $5 each per journey.)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed three nights in this hotel at the beginning of our holiday. It is situated near a number of tourist elements located in SF such as the Alcatraz dock, cable car terminus and Pier 39.
reviews.title: Perfect base to explore...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel were very polite and courteous and seemed glad to offer help whenever we required it. The room was as expected for a Holiday Inn, spacious, comfy etc. My only small complaint was that being on the front of the hotel, the main road was still quite noisy at night, however it didn't really disrupt our nights sleep.
reviews.title: Nothing Fancy but Nothing Offensive but Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Other than that the hotel has a perfect location for a tourist wanting to explore SF.
reviews.title: An average place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Holiday Inn, Fishermans Wharf for our last stop as part of our fly-drive holiday exploring the West Coast. The itinerary was set by Virgin Holidays so we weren't able to choose the hotels we stayed at during our two week holiday.
reviews.title: I've been staying here forever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel itself is what you'd expect from a city Holiday Inn, nothing fancy but nothing offensive either. The biggest plus for this hotel is the location - it's within walking distance to Fishermans Wharf, cable cars and ferries to Alcatraz.
reviews.title: Nice, well-located hotel but amenities could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005
reviews.text: First off - if you are driving in to the SF area - stop off at any rest stop and grab one of those hotel coupons book (we used the "Traveler"). With our coupon we really saved a lot of money for our 6 night stay. We were quoted between $219-$250 and wound up getting a room for $145 on Fri and Sat and $129 for week day nights. Being right in the heart of the Fisherman's Wharf area for this amount of money was truly a bargain! We also got an upgrade from a standard room to a room on the "business level" which is on the 5th floor. Never hurts to ask for an upgrade and we didn't have to pay any additional fees.
reviews.title: Happy at the Holiday Inn
Great Location - right in the heart of things
reviews.text: I was informed that this hotel had been recently renovated to the tune of several million dollars. Not sure if I buy that or not but the room was extremely clean with the following ammenities: a key safe, king size bed, chair w/ ottoman, desk, iron and ironing board, roomy bathroom, nice sopas, shampoos, etc., hairdryer, and black-out drapes (a must!). Also, wireless internet access is free! Our particular room (room 560) didn't have a closet or an armoire so we had to use a valet on wheels to hang our clothes. Strange but it worked and there was plenty of room to put it against the wall without it getting in the way.

reviews.title: Don't understand bad reviews!
reviews.text: Our room faced "The Cannery" and had a view of Alcatraz. You could see a little bit of the Pacific Ocean but I would not call it an "ocean view". Basically your view from our particular room on the 5th floor was the Marriot Hotel! But overall I wasn't unhappy with what I saw outside the window. I don't think this view would be as good on any of the other floors (there are only 5). I also agree with another reviewer regarding the noise level from the street. It was noisy with the "Dirty Martini" bar across the street and cars/bikes passing by but honestly if you can get a piece of pizza 'til 2:00 in the morning across the street at "Fisherman's Pizza" - can you really complain??? And after all, you're in a big city! If you are looking for quiet, head south on Road 1 to the Big Sur area!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005
reviews.text: The staff were extremely accomodating from the bell hop to the concierge. If you plan to stay in the city for at least 3 days pick up a "Muni Pass" which will allow you to jump on a bus anywhere in the city... it's really worth it.
reviews.title: hotel from hell
Great location, clean hotel with brilliant service.
reviews.text: The hotel lists an outdoor heated pool and a fitness facility. The pool is small but we didn't really come here to swim anyway and the fitness facility consists of 2 treadmills, 2 ellipticals, and a bike - there is also a television.

aka: Holiday Inn San Francisco Fishermans Wharf Hotel San Francisco
description: For business travel or San Francisco, California vacations, Holiday Inn San Francisco Fisherman s Wharf hotel welcomes you to the Bay City. When searching for top San Francisco hotels near Fisherman s Wharf, stay in comfort at our full-service San Francisco lodging. Walk to attractions including Pier 39, Alcatraz, Bay Cruise ferries and Ghirardelli Square. Hop on a cable car outside our hotel to visit Union Square, Financial District, Moscone Convention Center, Chinatown and AT&T Ballpark. After exploring the area, retreat to our San Francisco, California hotel to unwind in a room appointed with high-speed Internet access, in-room games and pay-per-view movies. For dining, enjoy a meal at the 24-hour Denny s or head to our Bristol Bar & Grill for a tantalizing meal and a drink. Additional on-site amenities include: laundry facilities, fitness center, an outdoor heated pool with sundeck and secure parking is available for $41 per day. Reserve your stay at our pet-friendly hotel in San Francisco, CA to be greeted with attentive service and superb accommodations in an unmatched locale. For spectacular savings, book a San Francisco travel package or hotel deal.
